p: Lopinavir is a protease inhibitor which targets the HIV virus. It was identified by 1998 and approved b the FDA by 2000. This drug prevents the formation of viral proteins by disrupting the proteolytic processing by mimicking its structure as a peptide cleaved by HIV protease. This drug along with another flu drug oseltamivir was reported to result in complete recovery after showing signs of COVID-19 related pneumonia ( Wu et al., 2020a, Wu et al., 2020b).
